IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: Academy for Urban School Leadership is a Chicago nonprofit school management organization that creates schools of excellence by developing highly effective teachers and transforming educational outcomes for students in the lowest performing schools.
IRS990.MissionDesc: Academy for Urban School Leadership is a nonprofit school management organization that creates schools of excellence by developing highly effective teachers and transforming educational outcomes for students in the lowest performing schools.
IRS990.Desc: Teaching Academies and Teacher Development - Academy for Urban School Leadership (AUSL) created the Chicago Teacher Residency program, which prepares new, highly effective teachers using an innovative approach based on an intense, full-year apprenticeship of learning and training with a mentor teacher. The program is based in neighborhood Chicago Public Schools (CPS) managed by AUSL. During the program, residents take Master's level coursework, earn a degree from a university partner, and become eligible for an Illinois educator license (if not already licensed). Upon completion of the program, as teachers in CPS schools, the graduates become part of a growing resource of specially trained teachers prepared to dramatically improve chronically underperforming Chicago Public Schools. As of June 2018, AUSL has trained over 1000 teacher residents committed to teaching in high-poverty areas in Chicago. AUSL continues to provide teacher professional development for teachers across the AUSL network of 31 schools, including individualized coaching and school-based, network-wide professional development programs. These highly effective teachers serve over 16,000 students.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: School Management - The Board of Education of Chicago Public Schools selects failing schools in need of critical transformation and contracts with AUSL to manage the process on its behalf. AUSL executes a rigorous, comprehensive and proven whole-school restart model that has become a national model for reform. The transformation begins with new requirements of school leadership and staff, additional after-school programs, and training. The transformation is further supported with AUSL management services which include curriculum development, performance management, teacher development, curricular enhancements, as well as assistance with parental involvement and community initiatives. A new climate and culture of success at the school is based on high expectations for student achievement. Overall, the CPS schools managed by AUSL have demonstrated outstanding and consistent improvement in student gains and student outcomes.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: Advisory services - AUSL shares its expertise and experience in improving chronically failing schools and training highly effective teachers with other school districts. Through its advisory services, AUSL offers the tools, framework, and coaching for transformative teacher development and school management.

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Provide information to state legislators on education reform topics.

The financial statement effects of a tax position taken or expected to be taken are recognized in the financial statements when it is more likely than not, based on the technical merits, that the position will be sustained upon examination. As of June 30,2018, AUSL had no uncertain tax positions that qualify for recognition or disclosure in the financial statements.

RecipientTable.PurposeOfGrantTxt: CURRICULAR ENHANCEMENTS FOR TUTORING, SOCIAL EMOTIONAL SUPPORT, COLLEGE READINESS, ARTS AND ATHLETICS.

GrantsOtherAsstToIndivInUSGrp.GrantTypeTxt: Scholarship for Masters Degree in education

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Scholarship winners are selected through an extensive process including mock teaching, videos, phone interviews, essays and college GPA. The organization provides mentoring and training to all scholarship students throughout the program, thus ensuring that scholarship funds are being properly utilized.
THE ORGANIZATION IS REPORTING THE NUMBER OF CONTRIBUTIONS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section A, line 2
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: James Cowie and Bob King have a business relationship through Rasmussen College.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 11b
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The final draft of the Form 990 is reviewed by the Executive Director and the Managing Director, Operations and Strategy. The Finance Committee reviews and provides comments. A final copy is distributed electronically to each member of the Board of Directors.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 12c
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: All employees and board members are required to complete a conflict of interest statement which is reviewed for conflicts. Annually, employees and board members are asked to sign a new form to ensure compliance. Any conflicts will be dealt with according to procedure.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section B, line 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: Executive Director and Managing Directors' compensation levels are reviewed annually. Periodically, compensation is benchmarked relative to officers in similar non-profit education organizations as well as in urban school districts. A compensation survey is also used. Any changes to compensation for the Executive Director and Managing Directors are approved by the Executive Committee.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: Form 990, Part VI, Section C, line 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: The AUSL governing documents, conflict of interest policy and financial statements are available upon request.
